channel.title: Adding gift card support on squarespace, rather than coupons
channel.description: [quote="janis@may28th.me"] Hey there, I found you listed as developers for squarespace and wanted to see if you would have any interest in helping us out. We have an online store looking for a solution to have gift card support in squarespace. As you might know squarespace only has coupon support and a true gift card functionality is not available. Do you have any ideas how to have a workaround that would support : - checkout with a unique coupon that covers price of product and shipping. i.e. 39+5$ - automated way of selling a gift card on the same store, so no manual labor is needed. Cheers and let me know your thoughts on this and possible timeline/pricing. [image: Inline image 3] *Janis* Technical Director www.may28th.me [image: May28th on Twitter] [image: May28th] [image: May28th on Tumblr] [image: May28th] [image: May28th on Tumblr] [/quote]

item.title: Adding gift card support on squarespace, rather than coupons
item.dc:creator: @cregox Caue Rego
item.description:
@cregox wrote:

I'm not very familiar with squarespace coupons, but squarespace doesn't really allow for much customization of the commerce. I did manage, for instance, to add a limiting checkout for another customer, but that was a minor modification. You can see it at work on my shop test.

I could probably make something similar for your first request, but the coupon codes would have to be manually added on the advanced code injection script, which wouldn't be too hard...

The problem there is automating anything. I'm really not sure what you mean there, by "no manual labor" and all, but I find it really hard to automate whatever with such a closed system as this squarespace commerce unfortunately is.

In any case, here there are 2 alternatives I haven't tried, that may suit you: https://answers.squarespace.com/questions/17702/can-i-sell-and-use-gift-cards-with-squarespace-commerce

Also I did notice Jason Barone asked that question over 1 year ago. Maybe he managed to develop something ( if you do go to him and find out a solution, please let me know! ).

I could find nothing on the developer docs to support this would be possible there. I still didn't have the opportunity to go on developer mode, but as far as I can tell, it's only good for customizing templates and it gives just slightly more and still much limited access to the locked in squarespace backend data.

I feel like your best bet will probably be going with www.GiftFly.com like tashography pointed in that answer:
